p: Female specific-pathogen-free Sprague Dawley (SD) rats (weight: 200 ± 20 g, six to eight-week-old) at sexual maturity were supplied by Chengdu Dashuo Experimental Animals Co., Ltd. (Sichuan, China). Animal welfare and experimental procedures were strictly conducted in accordance with the Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals and the related ethical regulations of Chengdu University of TCM (CDUTCM, permit CDU2019S121). The rat experiments used in this study were performed in compliance with the Guidelines for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals published by the U.S. National Research Council (8th edition, National Academies Press 2011). The zebrafish received humane care according to the criteria of the National Institutes of Health and the Georgia Institute of Technology Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee.
